definitions.definition: A subordinating conjunction that can convert a clause into a complement clause, i.e. one that completes a grammatical construction in the predicate and that describes or is identified with the subject or object .
examples: "That" is a complementizer in the sentence "Mary believes that it is raining".

main_definition: ( linguistics ) A subordinating conjunction that can convert a clause into a complement clause, i.e. one that completes a grammatical construction in the predicate and that describes or is identified with the subject or object .
